Module com.example.dmscoursework
Package com.example.dmscoursework.View.Level

Class LevelBuilder

java.lang.Object
com.example.dmscoursework.View.Level.LevelBuilder
public class LevelBuilder extends Object
The LevelBuilder is in charge of creating levels. The levels that are needed to be beat are walls that are needed to broken, so the LevelBuilder will build walls according to theme specified for the level.
Since:
04-01-2022
Version:
1.0
Author:
William Michiel Simson van Dijkhuizen

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    LevelBuilder(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio, String theme)
    Constructs the levelBuilder class by specifying area with a Rectangle area, and specifying the number of bricks as well as the number of rows as an integer argument, also specifies the size of the brick with a double argument as well as the theme of the level.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelBuilder

      public LevelBuilder(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio, String theme)
      Constructs the levelBuilder class by specifying area with a Rectangle area, and specifying the number of bricks as well as the number of rows as an integer argument, also specifies the size of the brick with a double argument as well as the theme of the level.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - a Rectangle, where bricks for level will be created.
      brickCount - an integer, which is number of bricks.
      lineCount - an integer, which is number of rows of bricks.
      brickDimensionRatio - a double, which is size of bricks.
      theme - a String, which is theme of the level.

    • MakeBrick

      public Brick MakeBrick(javafx.geometry.Point2D point, javafx.geometry.Dimension2D size, int type)
      Makes a brick by specifying its position with a Point2D argument, and specifying the size with a Dimension2D argument and type of brick with an int argument.
      Parameters:
      point - a Point, position of the brick.
      size - a Dimension, height and width of the brick.
      type - an integer, type of brick.
      Returns:
      a Brick of a specific type.
